str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
When, at what time. From the base of pou and te; interrogative adverb, at what time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A lord, master, or prince. Perhaps from deo and posis; an absolute ruler.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
And, even, also, namely.
True (lit: made of truth), real, genuine. From alethes; truthful.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To dwell in, settle in, be established in (permanently), inhabit. From kata and oikeo; to house permanently, i.e. Reside.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To give justice over, defend, avenge, vindicate. From ekdikos; to vindicate, retaliate, punish.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
